metadata.title: USN-6227-1 -- SpiderMonkey vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Several security issues were discovered in the SpiderMonkey JavaScript library. If a user were tricked into opening malicious JavaScript applications or processing malformed data, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to JavaScript security, including denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6227-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libmozjs-102-0 - 102.13.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 libmozjs-102-dev - 102.13.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 No subscription required
